play.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: when children play, they do things that they enjoy, often with other people or with toys
play.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Kids were playing and chasing each other.

Outside, the children were playing cowboys and Indians.

play.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to take part or compete in a game or sport
play.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Karen began playing basketball when she was six.
If you feel any pain, you shouldn’t play.

play.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: to use a particular piece, card, person etc in a game or sport
play.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: Harrison played a ten of spades.

play.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: to take a particular position on a team
play.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: Garvey played first base for the Dodgers.
play.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: to hit a ball in a particular way or to a particular place in a game or sport
play.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: She played the ball low, just over the net.
play.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: to perform a piece of music on a musical instrument
play.translation[0].definitions[5].examp: He’s learning to play the piano.

play.translation[0].definitions[6].defin: if a radio, CD etc plays, or if you play it, it produces sound, especially music
play.translation[0].definitions[6].examp: DJs playing the latest house and techno tracks
play.translation[0].definitions[7].defin: to perform the actions and say the words of a particular character in a theatre performance, film etc
play.translation[0].definitions[7].examp: Streep plays a shy, nervous woman.

play.translation[0].definitions[8].defin: if a play or film is playing at a particular theatre, it is being performed or shown there
play.translation[0].definitions[8].examp: ‘Macbeth’ is playing at the Theatre Royal in York.
play.translation[0].definitions[9].defin: if actors play a theatre, they perform there in a play
play.translation[0].definitions[10].defi: to behave as if you are a particular kind of person or have a particular feeling or quality, even though it is not true
play.translation[0].definitions[10].exam: the accusation that scientists are playing God
Some snakes fool predators by playing dead.
‘What do you mean?’ ‘Don’t play dumb (=pretend you do not know something).'

He played the fool (=behaved in a silly way) at school instead of working.
Susan felt she had to play the good wife.
play.translation[0].definitions[11].defi: to behave in a particular way in a situation, in order to achieve the result or effect that you want
play.translation[0].definitions[11].exam: How do you want to play this meeting?

play.translation[0].definitions[12].defi: if a smile plays about someone’s lips, they smile slightly
play.translation[0].definitions[13].defi: if light plays on something, it shines on it and moves on it
play.translation[0].definitions[13].exam: the sunlight playing on the water
play.translation[0].definitions[14].defi: if a fountain plays, water comes from it

play.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: things that people, especially children, do for amusement rather than as work
play.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: Play is very important to a child’s development.

the happy shouts of children at play
play.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: the effect or influence of something
